entities.description: Includes variables such as work status, immigrant status, and household roster.
Includes variables for different substances such as cigarettes, smokeless tobacco, cigars, pipe tobacco, alcohol, marijuana, cocaine, crack, and heroin.
Represents the income level of respondents.
Represents whether the respondent has health insurance.
Includes variables related to psychological distress, suicidal thoughts and behaviors, and major depressive episodes.
Includes variables such as past year disorder and disorder severity for alcohol and drugs.
Indicates imputation levels for variables: from interview, logically assigned, or statistically imputed.

relationships.description: Indicates that the survey includes demographic variables.
Indicates that the survey includes substance use variables.
Indicates whether the respondent has health insurance.
Indicates that the survey includes mental health variables.
Indicates that the survey includes substance use disorder outcomes.
Indicates the imputation indicator levels for each variable.
